Posts.Content: Lynni35 wrote: I just went for a six month follow up to follow up on calfication, mammo showed 4 more calcifications. Have to have biopsy because there were more. Has anyone had a six month follow up show more calcifications and have it be benign? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Scared! Lynni35 aven

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2016 09:48AM Lynni35 wrote: They were round microcals, 4 more in 6 months, linear. I got my results and it was benign. I think I might stick around here though, try to offer some support to others going through it.
Posts.Title: Scared! Lynni35 aven

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2016 02:14PM - edited Jul 28, 2016 02:25PM by Lynni35 Hi Aj77, I just went through this. Microcalcifications found on yearly mammo last Dec. Had to follow up with a 6 month mammo in June. 4 new microcalcifications showed on that mammo. Birads 4. Had stereotactic biopsy. Benign. I had to lie on a table with a hole to put the breast in, table is raised and radiologist sits underneath. Did not feel a thing. Honestly? The hard table is more uncomfortable than biopsy itself. This was my second biopsy. As my Dr told me, ANY increase in microcals is reason for concern. I am glad they are out. All removed with biopsy.
Posts.Title: Wondering....could this be good? Mama_V Lynni35
